title: Lesson 57
paragraph: Descriptions of appearance, condition and taste — useful for talking about things and situations.

words.meaning: pleasing to the senses or mind; attractive
words.example: She wore a beautiful dress to the party.

words.meaning: empty or without any writing or marks
words.example: The paper was blank; he hadn't started yet.

words.meaning: giving out or reflecting a lot of light; intelligent
words.example: The morning sun made the room bright.

words.meaning: wide from one side to the other
words.example: They walked along the broad avenue.
We found a cheap hotel near the station.
Keep the kitchen clean after cooking.

words.meaning: easy to perceive, understand, or interpret; transparent
words.example: The instructions were clear and easy to follow.
It's common to see bicycles in this town.

words.meaning: having all necessary parts or finished
words.example: The set is now complete with all pieces.

words.meaning: suiting one's needs or purpose easily and comfortably
words.example: The store’s location is very convenient for commuters.
Make sure your answers are correct before turning the test in.

words.meaning: likely to cause harm or injury
words.example: Swimming alone in rough seas can be dangerous.
